setErrorManager

public void setErrorManager(ErrorManager _errorManager)
Set the ErrorManager the Blackboard should use to manage and report errors.

Parameters:
_errorManager - a object that extends ErrorManager
See Also:
ErrorManager, Blackboard

setMaxBlackboardThread

public void setMaxBlackboardThread(int _maxBlackboardThread)
Set the maximum number of threads that should be available to recieve new events placed on the Blackboard. As such these thread represents the entry point for new activity for the Blackboard. The default value of 1 should be sufficient for most applications.

Parameters:
_maxBlackboardThread - the maximum number of threads to be made available for event reception.
See Also:
Blackboard

setMaxScheduledBlackboardThread

public void setMaxScheduledBlackboardThread(int _maxScheduledBlackboardThread)
Set the maximum number of threads that should be available to recieve new events to be scheduled for arrival on the Blackboard. As such these thread represents the entry point for new activity for the Blackboard. The default value of 1 should be sufficient for most applications.

Parameters:
_maxScheduledBlackboardThread - the maximum number of threads to be made available for scheduled event reception.
See Also:
Blackboard

setMaxWorkspaceThread

public void setMaxWorkspaceThread(int _maxWorkspaceThread)
Set the maximum number of threads that should be available to process Workspaces. Depending on how intensive your application is adjusting this value may have an effect on how your application performs.

Parameters:
_maxWorkspaceThread - the maximum number of threads to be made available for event reception.
See Also:
Blackboard

setMaxPersistenceThread

public void setMaxPersistenceThread(int _maxPersistenceThread)
Set the maximum number of threads that should be available to automatically persist Workspaces upon completion. Depending on how intensive your application is adjusting this value may have an effect on how your application performs.

Parameters:
_maxPersistenceThread - the maximum number of threads to be made available for workspace persistence.
See Also:
Persister

setMaxWorkspace

public void setMaxWorkspace(int _maxWorkspace)
Set the maximum number of Workspaces that should be available in memory. Depending on how intensive your application is adjusting this value may have an effect on how your application performs. Whenever the Blackboard exceeds this many workspaces, idle workspaces may be persisted via the assigned persister. Only use this option if there is a memory concern. If the processing threads counts are adjusted accordingly, the default value of 100000 should prove to be sufficient.

Parameters:
_maxWorkspaceThread - the maximum number of workspaces to be made available in memory.
See Also:
Workspace

setPersister

public void setPersister(Persister _persister)
Set the Persister that should be available to persist Workspacees. The Inkwell persister is already set as the default.

Parameters:
_persister - the maximum number of threads to be made available for event reception.
See Also:
Blackboard

setTimePlans

public void setTimePlans(boolean _timePlans)
Turn on plan processing monitoring. The times for plan processing will be posted to a log4j file. This should be set to false for production support.

Parameters:
_timePlans - set to true iff timing plans is required.
See Also:
Blackboard

setAppsHome

public void setAppsHome(java.lang.String _appsHome)
The root directory for all the apps to be run by this blackboard.

Parameters:
_appsHome - the root directory for all the applications to be run by this Blackboard.
See Also:
Blackboard
